Class Box

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Box
public abstract class Box extends greenfoot.Actor
The Box is literally a box that exists for collision detection. It can be visibile or invisible depending on what you want. It also can follow an "owner" actor to act as a hitbox, or something like an indicator for an attack's range.

But in the end, it's just a box. I swear.

Version:
2024-03-08
Author:
Freeman Wang

  • Constructor Details

    • Box

      public Box(int width, int height, boolean visible, greenfoot.Actor owner, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Creates a CollisionBox that is tied to an owner, but with an offset.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the CollisionBox.
      height - The height of the CollisionBox.
      visible - Whether the CollisionBox should be visible.
      owner - The Actor that the CollisionBox should follow.
      xOffset - The x offset in pixels, for the CollisionBox's following.
      yOffset - The y offset in pixels, for the CollisionBox's following.

      public greenfoot.Actor getOwner()
